comment.narrative: 1.1. The index of citizens’ satisfaction from local services - Baseline (2014): 3.34 - Target (2018) 3.45 1.2. Citizens satisfaction with the access to information provided by the local authorities - Baseline (2014): 3.33 - Target (2018) 3.5 1.3. Number of municipalities preparing the Quality of life reports - Baseline (2014): 10 - (2018)-81 1.4. Number of municipalities participating in the grant scheme and number of priority projects of 8 planning regions- Baseline (2017): 0- Target (2018) 38 1.5. Number of municipalities that will have automated management system in place - Baseline (2017) - 0 (2018) Design and dev’t of the system 2.1. Number of municipalities that have developed Integrated and Inclusive Local Development Plans which incorporate implementation of the additional competences - Baseline (2017)-0 Target (2018): 30 2.2. Number of project stakeholders (municipalities, CSOs, business community) that actively use the knowledge platform Baseline (2017):0 Target (2018) Knowledge platform deployed

The project activities were implemented accordingly as per the workplan, despite the small delays, which did not affect the quality and the pace of the project on a large scale. The political situation and the political crisis, alongside with the change of the local structure and the local administration did influence the expected targets, particularly in the measurement of the citizen’s satisfaction. The project will take as a baseline the 2017 Survey and indicators and will follow the indexes accordingly. Taking into consideration the 2017 baselines, the 2018 survey shows increase in the satisfaction from local services delivery but slight decrease in the access to information. Namely, the index of citizens’ satisfaction from local services delivered in 2018 is (3.12), which shows a bit increase with the 2017 index (3.09) and a decrease as per the 2014 (3.34). The index of citizens’ satisfaction with the access to information provided by local authorities in 2018 has decreased for 0.1 percent or (2.94) in 2018 and (2.95) in 2017. By the end of 2018 all municipalities were included in the process of preparation of Quality of life reports (81). In 2018, 30 municipalities were included in the secondary procurement grant scheme, applied and started with implementation of one priority project. Also, 8 priority projects by the 8 planning regions were selected and started with implementation as part of the regional secondary procurement grant scheme. In 2018, 30 small rural and urban municipalities started the process of preparation of the Integrated and Inclusive Development Plans. Also, during 2018 an in-depth analysis was conducted in terms of the proposed IT tools within the project document which were also granted with conditionality by the donor i.e. based on the needs of the target group the IT tools and the activities in this category can be amended accordingly. Following the analysis, the technical specification for preparation and deployment of the e-knowledge platform was prepared accordingly. Nevertheless, the automated management system foreseen as per the project document was identified as obsolete by the stakeholders and it was proposed new IT tool which under negotiation with both municipalities and the Ministry of Local Self-Government was accepted. The new proposed system for Integrated Planning is in process of consultation and overall definition.

1.1. The index of citizens’ satisfaction from local services - Baseline (2014): 3.34 - Target (2017) 2.80 1.2. Citizens satisfaction with the access to information provided by the local authorities - Baseline (2014): 3.33 - Target (2.95) 1.3. Number of municipalities preparing the Quality of life reports - Baseline (2014): 10 - (Target- 0)

The project preparatory activities for the preparation of Quality of Life Reports begun and the target will be measured in 2018. Due to the political situation and the political crisis in the country, as well as the large discrepancy in measuring the citizens satisfaction between the years 2014 and 2017, the first 2017 Survey will set the baselines for the overall project impact on the improvement of local services. The index of citizens’ satisfaction from local services delivered is 2.80, which shows a decrease with the 2014 last measurement (3.34). The index of citizens’ satisfaction with the access to information provided by local authorities has decreased from 2015 to 2.95 from 2014 (3.3) and will be used as baseline indicators. Due to the long political crisis in the period from 2015 to 2017, followed by political conflicts, protests and the disclosure of numerous abusers and local carriers of power in some municipalities led to a significant change of government in most of the municipalities in the local 2017 elections and a decrease in the citizen’s satisfaction indexes. The 2015-2017 Report on Program and Action Plan for Decentralization in cooperation with the Ministry of Local Self-Government was prepared. The first Decentralization Conference/National Mayor’s Forum “Getting Decentralization Right” was held, with over 200 participants including all Mayors and local administration, alongside with all major partners active in the process of fiscal decentralization;
